fields.title: Terms of Service
fields.content:
Quietly, Alibaba’s fintech affiliate Ant Group has been building a global cross-border payments network by partnering with or investing in third-party e-wallets, banks, remittance services and other ecosystem players.

The latest added to Ant’s alliance is 2C2P, a Singapore-based company that helps enterprises in Southeast Asia move money across borders. According to an announcement released on Monday, Ant will form a strategic partnership with 2C2P and become its largest shareholder, though a figure for the acquisition wasn’t disclosed. With the deal, the Singaporean firm’s network of merchants will be plugged into Alipay+, Ant’s cross-border payments platform.

“Through this complementary partnership with Ant Group, 2C2P will be connected to a much larger merchant base and be well-positioned to advance our international expansion strategy,” Aung Kyaw Moe, founder and CEO of 2C2P, said in a statement, adding that the partnership will help extend the company’s “current 250 payment options” to include more e-wallets and payments methods.

Rather than building its own country-specific wallet from the ground up and acquiring the needed regulatory permits to operate such services, Ant has chosen the route of partnership. It launched Alipay+ in 2020 and has so far teamed up with a slew of third-party payment methods, including banks and also e-wallets like Touch ‘n Go in Malaysia, GCash in the Philippines, KakaoPay in South Korea, TrueMoney in Thailand, Dana in Indonesia, bKash in Bangladesh, and Klarna in Europe.

Alipay+ comes in handy when a user traveling, working, or studying abroad wants to pay a local merchant, whether it’s online or offline, in their home country’s currency. If the retailer supports an e-wallet that works with Alipay+, the user can pay using Alipay+’s partnering wallet for the transaction, skipping the hassle of exchanging currency at a bank.
fields.seo_description: Quietly, Alibaba’s fintech affiliate Ant Group has been building a global cross-border payments network by partnering with or investing in third-party e-wallets, banks, remittance services and other ecosystem players.

fields.title: Getting started with Takadah
fields.content:
Quietly, Alibaba’s fintech affiliate Ant Group has been building a global cross-border payments network by partnering with or investing in third-party e-wallets, banks, remittance services and other ecosystem players.

The latest added to Ant’s alliance is 2C2P, a Singapore-based company that helps enterprises in Southeast Asia move money across borders. According to an announcement released on Monday, Ant will form a strategic partnership with 2C2P and become its largest shareholder, though a figure for the acquisition wasn’t disclosed. With the deal, the Singaporean firm’s network of merchants will be plugged into Alipay+, Ant’s cross-border payments platform.

“Through this complementary partnership with Ant Group, 2C2P will be connected to a much larger merchant base and be well-positioned to advance our international expansion strategy,” Aung Kyaw Moe, founder and CEO of 2C2P, said in a statement, adding that the partnership will help extend the company’s “current 250 payment options” to include more e-wallets and payments methods.

Rather than building its own country-specific wallet from the ground up and acquiring the needed regulatory permits to operate such services, Ant has chosen the route of partnership. It launched Alipay+ in 2020 and has so far teamed up with a slew of third-party payment methods, including banks and also e-wallets like Touch ‘n Go in Malaysia, GCash in the Philippines, KakaoPay in South Korea, TrueMoney in Thailand, Dana in Indonesia, bKash in Bangladesh, and Klarna in Europe.

Alipay+ comes in handy when a user traveling, working, or studying abroad wants to pay a local merchant, whether it’s online or offline, in their home country’s currency. If the retailer supports an e-wallet that works with Alipay+, the user can pay using Alipay+’s partnering wallet for the transaction, skipping the hassle of exchanging currency at a bank.

Alipay+ also comes with a suite of marketing tools that allow merchants to offer deals and discounts for customer engagement, a business model that it has proven in China’s mobile-first payments market over the years.

The fintech giant has long had globalizing goals and set out years ago by targeting China’s outbound tourists. While Alipay focuses on China’s domestic consumers and merchants, its sister Alipay+ appears to be Ant’s ambition to go after users outside China who have similar cross-border payments needs.

Ant’s plans to pursue an initial public offering were shelved in November 2020 after the Chinese government ordered a regulatory overhaul into its financial practices, which subsequently made some of its China-based businesses less lucrative. Ramping up overseas expansion could be a way for the behemoth to sustain growth.

Ant says Alipay+ has served more than 1 billion users in Asia and 1 million offline merchants across Europe and Asia. Online, it has connected payments providers to customers on platforms like Apple, Foodpanda, Google and TikTok.
fields.seo_description: Quietly, Alibaba’s fintech affiliate Ant Group has been building a global cross-border payments network by partnering with or investing in third-party e-wallets, banks, remittance services and other ecosystem players.

fields.title: First Chapter
fields.text:
After crossing the doors, the fresh air and sunlight hit Harry's face, making him smile, the euphoria taking place as he was now able to buy all the interesting things he saw. He looked over his shoulder to the bank, visualizing all the tunnels and rails right beneath his feet, thinking how that was achieved, and then, he remembered the word.

Magic.

"Harry, do you mind if I make a run for a tonic? That ride from hell made me all dizzy. I'll be back in a second, you can look around- Well, that one shop for a moment, but don't touch anything, I'll be right back." Hagrid said while walking strangely out of balance towards the Leaky Tap, and Harry mentally calculated his trip to the far end of the street would take at least 10 minutes.

Harry turned and found himself alone in this strange place. People wearing the weirdest clothing, giving him odd looks probably because of his outfit, goblins walking around with carts, and owls flying in plain view while still was daytime. He sighed and entered the first store on his left.

[Apothecary - Everything you need to your potions brewing]

Harry entered, and the smell hit him, a mix of eggs and rotted cabbages. He didn't mind the smell that much, walking inside while looking around.

"Hello there, young man. Hogwarts, I assume?" A middle-aged man asked from behind the counter, looking at him with a warm smile.

"Yes. I have a list-"

"Don't you worry, I have it memorized, let me get your things for you."

The man walked around the counter, going in the far back of the shop, followed by Harry, getting a strange casing full of what looked like dried roots and plants, pieces of fur, and vials containing liquids. He opened it so Harry could inspect it and explained:

"This is your potion kit, all the ingredients you'll need for your potion brewing, now for your cauldron."

"It says pewter, but they recommend another place for the cauldrons." Harry frowned, eyeing his notes.

"They are all the same, so you might as well just buy it all together, I'll even throw in a discount for you."

"All the same, in what way? I mean, is there another type other than pewter?"

"There is, I have a golden cauldron made of pure gold. Two hundred galleons and it's yours." The man pointed to a shiny cauldron on the top shelf.

Harry internally sighed at his pathetic attempt.

"Umm, I'll think I'll pass. I wanted to ask about the implications of these cauldrons though. I mean, if pewter is the basic one, what's the point of the others made of- What is that? Copper? And that one? Oh, that's pewter. Also that one, brass? What's the difference? How can the material impact the brewing of these... Potions." Harry pointed while making questions, but the man pointed to the golden cauldron again.

"Well, I don't really know about the details, but I recommend the golden one-"

Before the man could try again, a voice said from behind Harry:

"Pewter is the slowest of the three, but it's well suited for beginners because of its stability around any type of ingredient. That is the reason it's listed for students such as yourself."

Harry turned and saw a man wearing a full black set of clothes, his face was hard, his eyes deep and serious, his nose strangely big to his face, and his hair oily. With his hands behind his back, the man gestured with a nod towards the second cauldron.

"Copper is the fastest brewing cauldron among the three options, and by being the most efficient, it lacks stability, often reacting to brewing ingredients in strange ways, so is often used by masters who already know all these reactions and what causes them."

Harry nodded to this weird explanation, thinking that this man had a strange tone to his voice. He sounded like a teacher.

"Brass is the balance between efficiency and stability, allowing those who possess moderate and advanced knowledge on potions to extract the most benefits from it."

"Ah- Thank you very much, sir."

"Ah- Master Snape, I didn't see you entering-" The shopkeeper said while looking embarrassed.

"I came from the back entrance." The man named Snape pointed a long finger towards the other side of the store without deviating his gaze from the man and said in a tone that showed he wasn't happy.

"What exactly were you doing?"

"Well, I was just-"

"That was a rhetorical question, you were trying to sell that garbage to muggle-born clients, again."

"Er..."

"I'll advise the school to drop your employer as the recommended ingredient store the moment I set foot in Hogwarts, now get lost." The man's smile just vanished as he nodded once, returning to the front of the store, leaving both of them alone.

"As for you, I can see you have muggle roots by what you're wearing, but at least you're not dull like the others. Your questioning has merit in it, what's your name?"

"Harry Potter, and thank you for the help, sir." Harry thought giving a hand was too forward reading into the man's body posture, so he tried to slightly bow like he saw the goblins doing.

Harry noticed something changing in the man's face as if he was shocked by his name. What a strange thing, even though Hagrid explained to him he was kind of famous, he wasn't expecting celebrity statuses.

Suddenly, the man took a step closer and took Harry's bangs out of the way, so he could see the scar on his forehead. Harry found the action strange but just waited.

"So you're really here. I finally get to meet the famous Harry Potter." Harry noticed some kind of disgust in his voice, as his surname was spoken like it was something unpleasant.

"Ah- I'm sorry, but I'm not really famous, I mean, it is weird to be famous for doing something you don't even remember. I was a baby, so it's not like I did something." He shrugged, trying to understand why this person changed his tone so drastically when he learned his name.

"Wait, don't tell me that you don't know-" He started, but something made him just stare at the boy with intensity, something strange happening as the man looked away after a few seconds as if pondering something.

"Is this your first time in here? In the Diagonal Alley?" Snape asked, returning his gaze to Harry.

"Yes, sir. I was told yesterday about this- About this magic stuff. At first, I didn't believe it, but Hagrid- Ah, someone from Hogwarts came to my house last night. I'm sorry, I still don't know your name."

"I am Professor Severus Snape, Master of Potions, head of Slytherin."

"Umm, it's a pleasure to meet you, professor." Harry said, trying to understand what the hell was Slytherin.

"Tell me something, Potter, what would you do if you indeed were the most famous person of the wizardry world?"

Harry already had an answer to that question, because he thought about the exact same thing when Hagrid told him his story.

"If I was the most famous person? I'd wear a disguise. I don't want attention for doing something I can't even remember doing. Only someone who's incapable of doing things on their own would thrive on that."

Snape eyed his expression for some time before saying.

"Take your ingredients from here, but buy your cauldrons from Madam Potage's Cauldron Shop, they are specialized in selling those. Pewter, Potter." He said with a straight face before turning and paying for a package, leaving without another word.

Harry told Hagrid about the strange professor named Severus Snape and at the sound of his name, Hagrid instantly stopped walking.

"Professor Snape was here?"

"So he really is a professor, huh?"

"Yes, he teaches potions at Hogwarts."

"Hagrid, what exactly is Slytherin? He said he was the head of it."

"Oh, I'm sorry, Harry, I keep forgetting you don't know anything about these things."

"Please, don't make me feel worse."

"Sorry. Slytherin is one of the four houses of Hogwarts. When you start school, you'll be sorted in one of those houses, and they'll become your family inside the school."

"Why?"

"What you mean why?"

"Why would you divide students inside a place where everyone just wants to learn?"

"Well, they are divided because of the founders."

"Huh?"

"You'll learn everything about them from your history books, but I'll tell you the short version I remember from what I've read." Hagrid then started talking as if reading from a book, stopping sometimes to remember the exact term or phrase.

"It was said that the founders of Hogwarts wanted to invite new wizards to learn magic and develop the understanding of magic itself, so they sent invitations to those they deemed worthy of their teachings. Salazar Slytherin wanted only those of pure magic blood to attend and practice magic, so he created a house that would accommodate those of his choosing, who would do anything to achieve greatness. Most, if not all the Dark Lords, were from Slytherin."

Harry was absorbed in that explanation, it was like learning about a new book series, but at the same time, here he was, inside the book itself.

"Helga Hufflepuff was the complete opposite. She wanted to invite anyone who wanted to learn about magic, creating a house to accommodate those she deemed kind and fair, those who'd value friendship and loyalty above all else." Hagrid moved from the place they were standing to sit in front of an ice-cream store, asking the server for two parfaits before resuming his explanation.

"Rowena Ravenclaw was strict when the talk was about her students, wanting in her house only those who valued knowledge above all else. To those who wanted to learn about not only magic but about the unknown of life, she presented her hand to guide them. Ravenclaw produced most of the prodigies and the people who use their brains the most." Hagrid took a few spoons from his parfait before continuing.

"Godric Gryffindor wanted those who would be, in his view, the bravest. He wanted all those who'd never falter in face of obstacles, who would face death with a smile. To these brave wizards, he gave a place among his house, instructing them on how to become warriors full of virtue and courage. With that, they sent invitations to those they deemed worthy of their teachings, starting the houses."

"Which one is your house?"

"Ah- When I was in school I was sorted into Gryffindor."

Hagrid finished his explanation while they finished and paid up their sweet, resuming the shopping towards the bookstore, the next stop on Harry's list. There, Harry picked a few books related to the old and modern history of this world, so he could understand more. After exiting the book shop, Harry asked.

"I get it. They invited people who were like them in a way, but how could they know if a person belongs to their house? I mean, how would Gryffindor know someone belonged in his house because they were brave? Or how would Rowena know if someone was smart enough to join Ravenclaw? Was there some kind of test?"

"That is a secret. You'll understand when you arrive at Hogwarts, so just be patient."

Harry nodded, wondering if this secret was written in one of the books he just bought. He'd make sure to check.

"Now, you need new garments. Let's go to Madame Malkins, and while they take your measurements, I'll run an errand, all right? Just ask for the usual Hogwarts attire."

Harry nodded and saw the giant almost running down the street, people looking at him with angry faces. Harry was about to enter the store when he heard a commotion behind him.

"DAMN IT! AAAH! GET OUT OF THE WAY, THE GLASS BROKE. THEY'RE LOOSE."

A man started shouting and people jumped away, opening a space in a second, and Harry saw what was the problem. Two large snakes were hissing furiously on the ground, trying to lunge at a few bystanders. The boy heard the same thing he heard in the zoo a few months ago.

~How dare you?! You could have hurt us!~

Harry frowned at the fact that the voice was coming from one of the snakes, its voice in some sort of hissing whisper, making the boy cross the street, seeing people raising what he believe to be magical wands.

One of the men sent a spell and Harry's eyes went wide as the spell hit one of the snakes, sending it 2ft across the floor, and then it lunged again, hissing furiously, spitting venom.

"Damn it- We can't handle them, Ivar."

"I'll finish them, there's no other way- They're too poisonous! Vipera Evanesca." Another flash of light and the spell hit one of the snakes, but to everyone's surprise, it did nothing.

"We have to do it, Ivar-"

"I know, goddammit, this is going to be trouble. Avada-" A man started to point his wand, but before he could do anything, Harry touched his arm.

"Don't do that, whatever you're going to do, they're just angry because you dropped them."

"What?!" The man just stared at Harry who ignored his look, taking a step forward, kneeling next to the snake. From up close, the animal was huge, at least 3ft long, with very blue scales and tiny horns around the top of its head. The snake turned to Harry and hissed angrily, starting the movement to attack, but suddenly stopped when it heard the boy speaking.

~I'm sorry, but could you calm down? If you don't stop, they may hurt you and your friend.~

The snake instantly stopped and its body froze, looking at Harry with intelligent eyes, making the boy smile.

~You can speak our language?~ The snake asked in a lower hiss.

~I think so, I did it once with a Boa Constrictor.~

Harry was so absorbed in his conversation, that he wasn't aware of his surroundings. If he were, he would've probably stopped doing what he was doing, because everyone was horrified, seeing the boy speaking parseltongue, a few pointing while others were just taking steps back, trying to move away.

~Would you mind if I help you? I don't think it is good for you to move over all this broken glass.~

The second snake, a beautiful red-scaled serpent with golden eyes, turned and spoke, her hiss slightly different from the blue one. If Harry would guess, the blue one was a male, while the red one was a female.

~Thank you, wizard.~

~Can I touch you? To lift you from the glass?~

~Certainly.~ The blue one spoke.

Harry didn't feel fear, as he could see in their eyes that they weren't a treat, walking closer, offering his hand. The two snakes instantly starting using his arm as a ramp, slithering out of the broken glass, and making their way to rest on the boy's shoulders. At first, the movement made Harry's body shiver, as he expected a slimy body, but to his surprise, snakes were pretty dry, and although it was a weird feeling, he quickly got used to it. They stopped at both sides of his face, and now Harry was aware of his surroundings, turning to see people's faces, unable to hide his surprise to everyone pointing and whispering.

The man who probably was the owner of the snakes took a step forward and Harry said:

"They're angry because you were clumsy with their home. If you apologize and get them a new one, they won't complain." Harry conveyed the snakes' desires, as they kept hissing towards the man, turning to hiss at Harry's ears.

"And they want you to find proper food as well because they don't want to keep eating mice with a taste of decay."

"How the hell- How can you talk to snakes?"

"Huh? I don't know, this is the wizardry world, right? I bet there are many people who can."

"No, there's not."

And then Harry understood why they were all looking at him like that.

~They seem taken aback, but it is because those who can talk to us are not common nowadays, wizard. Ah, where are my manners, I am Ivy, and this is Ash.~ The red snake said and Harry answered:

~I'm Harry, Harry Potter, nice to meet you.~

"Potter, what in Merlin's name are you doing?"

Harry turned just to see Professor Snape, who came to check on the commotion and found Harry speaking parseltongue in broad daylight. A few people who heard that started whispering, their voices spreading like wildfire:

"Did he say, Potter?"

"Potter? As in Harry Potter?"

"Is he Harry Potter?"

Snape realized his mistake and quickly moved forward, giving Harry an angry look that made the boy defend himself.

"They were going to kill them, so I just came to help."

"Put them back." Snape walked closer to relieve Harry of the snakes, when the blue one, Ash, hissed violently towards the man, spitting venom at him.

~DON'T YOU DARE TO COME ANY CLOSER, HUMAN OR I'LL KILL YOU!~

~Calm down, Ash, they will kill you if you keep attacking them.~ Harry whispered, but the snake was enraged.

~LET THEM TRY!~ The snake hissed again and Harry saw that part of his scales were actually glowing.

"You, sir, could you find another enclosure for them? I mean right now, please!" Harry said, gesturing to the snakes, and the man ran inside the shop.

~I told you we should've killed the ones who captured us, Ivy. You're too docile to humans.~

~I like to watch them, you know that.~ The red snake said, moving towards the front of Harry's face, turning to stare at him curiously. Harry held her gaze and smiled.

The man returned with an enclosure twice his size, panting because of its weight, placing it in front of Harry, who turned and asked his two new friends:

~Is this to your liking?~

The snakes hissed something, making Harry walk closer to the enclosure, and slowly, they entered, looking around for some time. The man quickly came and used a lid to cover the enclosure, looking towards Harry who was completely calm.

"Are you out of your mind?! These are ancient dragon snakes- They could've killed you just by spitting venom into your eyes."

"Why would they do that?" Harry asked confused.

"Because they're beasts. They're wild animals."

Harry looked towards the glass and smiled before turning to the man.

"Ash said he can sense you're being disrespectful again, and he's saying they want to be freed." Harry translated in real-time, looking at professor Snape who was right next to him now.

"Move, Potter. You already brought enough attention to yourself."

"But-"

"Now!"

Harry felt this was an adult he shouldn't retort, turning to leave with the professor by his side, hearing Ivy speaking while he walked away:

~Do you really have to leave, Harry? Come visit us again if you can.~

"So you had to make it about yourself, hadn't you? I guess I was mistaken." Snape said while hiding Harry inside one store. The boy frowned at the teacher's tone and decided in that moment that what happened with the Dursleys for 12 years, wouldn't happen ever again.

"I didn't do that to show off- The snakes were angry because their owner mishandled their enclosure and practically threw them on the ground. And even after that, they were going to kill them."

"Still, speaking parseltongue in broad daylight, you won't tell me you didn't know what you were doing." Snape said with disdain.

"Wha- Professor Snape, have I done something to earn your antipathy? Because ever since I said my name, the way you spoke to me changed, and I don't appreciate that. As a professor you should understand that I had no contact with your world, so how should I know that talking to snakes was bad? Do you expect me to ask around if it's okay to walk, to breathe, or to speak? I don't know the rules, but I'll learn them as they present themselves to me, so I'd like for you to understand the reason I did it."

Snape kept listening, wondering why he sounded so much like Lily, even though his face was just like Potter's. Even his contained anger was just like hers.

"Very well, Mr. Potter, I'll explain the rules to you. Do not speak parseltongue around ordinary people, because such ability is directly connected to the dark arts. Do not reveal your name to anyone, because as much as people value you and your legacy, others still linger in the night, searching for the one responsible for the Dark Lord's demise, and lastly, understand that you have a role to play in the wizardry world, as you are the boy-who-lived, so you must act accordingly even if you do not want to."

"Understood, professor, but I won't be able to obey the last part."

"Excuse me? That was not a request, Potter."

"And this is not me pleading. I'm not asking your permission to live my life the way I want."

The way this boy spoke, took Snape aback, as he saw something dark inside him.

"If the term had begun, you would've lost more points than you can ever imagine because of your insolence."

Harry tilted his head for a few seconds while looking straight at the man.

"Ah, I get it, I understand now, professor, you're the same as her." He said with a sigh.

"The same as who?"

"My aunt Petunia. She also hates me, but here's the thing, I discovered yesterday that she hates me just because I'm my mother's son, so I'm wondering if this is your reason as well. Is that it? Is that why your voice changed after hearing my name? Do you hate me because of my mother, too? My father? Are you this shallow? Are you really capable of hating someone because of any mistakes their parents made?"

Snape was taken aback again and was unable to speak for a few moments, seeing the boy getting up.

"I'll return to my shopping day, and I understand the rules you taught me, so I won't misbehave, have a nice day, professor." He said while taking his things, and Snape said:

"You haven't been excused, Potter."

"And as you said just a moment ago, if the term had started, you'd have authority over me, but since it hadn't, you're simply a normal person talking to a boy, excuse me."

Harry got up and left, leaving Snape with a finger over his lips, wondering about all their exchange.

"Harry, where were you? I looked for you everywhere."

"Sorry, Hagrid, I got lost."

"Well, I heard the weirdest things, people saying Harry Potter was speaking to snakes or something like that."

"Huh, that's weird."

"Right? Anyway, let's finish your list. I see we got your books, your cauldron- Wait, you got two? The list only asks for one."

"I might have an interest in potions, so I got two types to see which one serves me better." Harry shrugged.

"Huh... All right. Next, we need... To get your clothes, I thought you already went there."

"As I said, I was kind of lost, but I know what to do now." Harry said while looking away and Hagrid tilted his head to how those words sound.

Hagrid stood outside because of the limited space inside the shop, but Harry could still see his massive body through the window.

"Hogwarts I assume?" The woman asked Harry who said yes and positioned himself next to a boy who was in the same position right next to him. Harry saw an enchanted measure tape moving by itself, starting to measure him, but before he could ask anything about that, his neighbor spoke.

"Hello there." A blonde boy asked with a cordial smile.

"Hey."

"Hogwarts as well?"

"Yea."

"My father is across the street gathering the books. It's really dull you can't take your broom to school, right?"

"I don't really know, I'm not familiar with brooms."

"You're a muggle-born?" The boy asked with an expression that showed only shock.

"Yea."

"Ah."

And that was all.

Harry imagined if this was exactly what he was thinking, and just for fun, tried the waters.

"What, something wrong with being a muggle-born?"

The blonde boy smirked, and Harry smiled back, trying to induce him to speak.

"It depends."

'Huh, so I guess this really is a racially divided society, who would've thought.' Harry thought and after the silence from his part, the boy spoke again:

"Why do you ask, were you offended?" His smirk grew and Harry chucked a little.

"Not at all, I'm just amused, would you mind telling me more about what you're talking about?"

"Perhaps, what you said your name was?" The blonde boy asked, trying to use the same way of speaking as the boy in front of him, finding it strange that a muggle-born could speak properly like that.

"I didn't. I'm Dudley. Dudley Dursley."

"Er- I'm Draco. Draco Malfoy." Draco simply nodded to the name given, thinking if this was actually the boy's name.

"So?" Harry asked while the tapes starting measuring him again.

"Well, most wizards don't have the same view as us, but they are of no importance either."

"And by you, you mean the people who don't like muggle-borns? Wait a second, are you some kind of race purist?" Harry tilted his head, going back a few decades, back to the forties to be accurate.

Draco simply smiled, and Harry nodded.

"I get it, so muggle-borns are what?"

"Impure half-breeds." Draco spat in a whisper and Harry looked around.

"So, are we less powerful than purebloods? Do we have limitations purebloods don't have? I mean, if we are impure half-breeds we must be weak in some way."

Draco closed his expression, unable to retort and after a few seconds of thinking, he whispered again, looking around.

"Muggles don't deserve our magic, so marrying them and mixing our blood is disgusting- I get it you don't like it, but it is how it is."

"Oh, I'm not angry at all, I'm just curious." Harry said, moving while the tape slightly pushed him to raise his arms.

"You're not offended?" Draco asked with curiosity because he intended to be offensive.

"Nope, because I shouldn't be. So far, all I can tell is that blood purists are simply bigots who'd like to maintain racial purity, probably marrying inside the family as well, which is disgusting, so why should I be offended by such people?"

"You dare to insult us? Do you have any idea who you're talking to?"

"Someone who was brainwashed."

The blonde boy now had an angry expression and Harry smiled at him before asking:

"Are you feeling insulted by being called a bigot? Do you know what brainwashed means? It means that a type of knowledge or belief was put inside your mind to the extent you cannot grasp it not being true, but I ask you the question that will set you free, answer me how are the muggle-borns inferior to purebloods." Harry asked the last part loudly and a few women that were stitching and talking looked over their shoulders.

"What?"

"Tell me how purebloods are better than muggle-borns, and I'll gladly be your lackey for the rest of my muggle-born life." Harry smiled at his bluff because even if purebloods were somehow stronger than muggle-borns, he'd find a way to change that. Draco simply frowned at his words, confused and slightly scared of his intensity, and after nothing but silence, Harry shook his head while speaking.

"Nothing? So you see what I'm seeing? If there really isn't a downside to being a half-breed, why should I be ashamed? I'm not offended at all, I'm simply disgusted by your assumption, and slightly sad that you were brainwashed like that, just that."

Before Draco could retort, a woman came to take the tape that was now on the floor next to the blonde boy.

"I'm all done with you, darling, oh your father is coming right this way."

Harry saw a blonde long-haired gentleman walking inside the store, stopping by the counter to pay for his son's clothes, his eyes stopping for a second at Harry's gaze.

"Anything wrong, boy?" He couldn't help but notice the look of disdain the man gave him, just like his son when they looked at his normal clothing.

"Not at all, I like your garments, they're very elegant." Harry said while eyeing his dark vest covered by a suit, covered by an overcoat with green details.

The man narrowed his eyes and returned his gaze to the counter, hearing his son whispering something that Harry deduced had something to do with the fact he was muggle-born or the talk they just had.

The man eyed him again and saw a glimpse of something when the boy used his hand to wipe sweat from his face.

"You, boy, what is your name?"

Harry felt his intensity, remembering in a second that his scar was in view, and that was practically an id with his name. He quickly answered.

"Dudley Dursley."

The man approached and Harry got straight, refusing to be intimidated, looking the man in the eyes as he said with a smirk.

"You have a very interesting scar there, Mr. Dursley, and you talk about some interesting things." He pointed a cane towards Harry's forehead, who just stood straight, eyeing him.

"Oh, what I was talking about with Draco? I was just curious about a few things I heard. May I know your name, sir?"

"It's Malfoy. Lucius Malfoy, and this is my son." He said without even looking at the boy right next to him, who was also staring at Harry's scar.

"Hello." Harry said with a half-bow, not wanting to offer his hand and use the usual muggle greeting, and not wanting to indicate it was a pleasure to meet him because he understood that these people were not worth it.

"My time is short, but I'm sure we'll meet in the near future, Mr. Dudley Dursley, and by that time I believe you'll understand more about the things you talk about with such confidence." Lucius said, his smirk vanishing, and Harry had enough.

"I'm sure we will, and I'm sure I will." As the words came out full of saturated anger, the tapes that were measuring him were thrown towards the walls, dropping to the ground where they stood motionless.

Lucius looked around and back at the boy, who was emanating his magic, and wondered why this child's magic remembered him so much of his lord's. He stared deep into his green eyes, but saw something that pleased him. Perhaps-

"Let's go, Draco."

"Yes, father. I'll see you in school, I guess." Draco said towards Harry who simply stared.

After the two left, Madam Malkins came asking why her tapes were all scattered around the room and Harry tried to explain, unaware of the faint glow in his blue ring.

"I believe this is everything, Harry, now for the last place. Let's get you your wand."

Harry just nodded and followed Hagrid in silence.

As they entered Olivanders and met the weird man, Harry felt uneasy, his past hours coming back to him, as he felt like an animal. He felt like Ivy and Ash. Placed on display because of his scar, defined by a past he couldn't even remember, hated by everyone for just existing, and now, discriminated by his heritage. He barely heard the very talkative man taking wands and placing them for Harry to hold. After a few minutes, Harry finally felt his wand accepting him, and Hagrid applauded.

"Curious, very curious."

Harry stared, looking back at Hagrid, and back to the man, who eyed him and saw the doubt in there.

"It's curious that you're destined to this wand, Mr. Potter because her twin gave you that scar."

Harry looked down, slowly nodding.

"So you're telling me that magic wands are made from magic materials, and sometimes, the same material can be used to create more than one wand and that the twin wand made of the same core as mine, belongs to Voldemort?"

Hagrid and Olivanders flinched from the name, but Harry didn't care.

"Yes, Mr. Potter. I believe this tells us we can expect great things from you, as the one-who-shall-not-be-named did great things, terrible of course, but great nevertheless."

Harry paid the wand and left with Hagrid, barely seeing where he was going, lost in thoughts.

"Harry, you look awfully sad, but I know exactly how to cheer you up. I want to give you a present for entering school, so I'll let you choose a pet. What do you think? You can have an owl, a toad, or a cat. I have an allergy to cats, and frogs are really lame and the other kids would laugh at you, so I'll get you an owl, well, it's not much of a choice but-" Hagrid said with a smile, taking Harry from deep thoughts, making the boy look at the giant and smile.

'Not all of them are bad.' He thought while the gentle giant was still looking at him with a smile.

"Thank you, Hagrid, but I don't want a pet."

"No? All boys your age like owls, they can deliver mail and stuff."

"Oh no, I wasn't clear, I meant to say that I don't want a pet, I want two."

"You must be joking, you again?" The man behind the counter asked frightened.

"You've been here already, Harry?" Hagrid asked while looking at the boy.

"Kinda." Harry said with a smile, looking inside the store, spotting Ivy and Ash inside their new enclosure.

"You don't know what happened? He-"

Before the man could tell Hagrid what happened, the door went open and Lucius entered followed by Draco.

"Oh, I believe our reunion was early than I expected, Mr. Dursley, or should I stop this charade and address you by your name, Potter?"

Harry eyed the man and answered with a firm voice.

"Potter will do."

"Lucius Malfoy?" Hagrid asked as if not believing his eyes.

"Ah, Hagrid." The man said as if his name meant something dirty. That made Harry's blood boil.

"Ah, welcome Mr. Malfoy, I have Draco's new owl ready for you, sir."

"Make haste then, we're late on our schedule." Lucius said, and the man vanished inside the store.

Harry saw Hagrid's posture change, as he felt the same disdain Harry felt a few minutes ago. The boy walked towards the enclosure and the snakes turned to see who it was.

~Ah, Harry, back so soon? Did you miss us already?~ Ivy asked with something resembling a laugh in her hiss.

~Heh, I was just thinking about something. Would you like to come with me?~

Harry heard a noise and looked over his shoulder to see that Hagrid had bumped into a pile of owl food, staring at him with horror, the same as Malfoy senior and junior.

"A parseltongue speaker?" Lucius said in a whisper, his gaze following Harry's eyes.

Whatever that was, Lucius was sure that boy was something else, perhaps exactly what they have been searching for. He quickly composed himself and approached Harry, his posture and expression completely changed.

"That's a rare gift, Mr. Potter."

"People keep telling me that." He said while turning his attention to the snakes.

"Ah, you're interested in dragon snakes?"

"I'm not interested in their species, I'm more interested in them." Harry answered coldly, quickly changing to parseltongue.

~So, would you like to come with me?~

~Yes!~ Ivy said while moving, climbing the enclosure to look at Harry's eyes again.

~Why? What are your intentions?~ Ash asked, maintaining some sense of pride while staying back.

~Umm, I hope this doesn't sound too offensive, but I want you to be my pets. I mean, for muggles, pets are more than just animals they bought for a purpose, and more like companions, or friends.~ Harry stopped for a second and faced Ash with intensity.

~So I want you to become my companions.~

Lucius kept staring at Harry while he kept speaking to the snakes, suddenly taking a step back when Harry took the lid off the enclosure.

"Ah- Mr. Potter- Dragon snakes are rather dangerous." Lucius started but saw in amazement as both snakes simply used Harry's extended arm to wrap themselves around and climb the boy, moving until they were wrapped around both of his arms, their heads resting by both sides of his face. Harry turned and looked at Lucius for a moment, and what the man saw there made him involuntary smile. The green-eyed boy, with two deadly snakes around his body, eyeing him with some kind of hidden arrogance, reminded him of his master.

"You know, people keep saying that, but they are not that bad. Ash here is just after some respect, while Ivy is just after affection." He gestured towards each snake and was taken aback when Ivy curled around his wrist, making him use his free hand to pet her head.

~Ah- That's it, right there.~ She said in a smiley hiss.

Harry chuckled and looked at Ash as if asking if he also wanted pets, but the blue dragon snake kept staring forward, his head held high as if saying he wouldn't go for such indignity.

"Marvelous. Indeed, they are very intriguing creatures, it is a shame they are not given their true value."

"Well, I'll take these two."

"OH MY- FOR MERLIN'S BEARD, WHY DID YOU TAKE THEM OUT?!" The owner returned and saw Harry playing with the snakes, an owl in a cage in his arms.

"I'll take them, sir."

"No, you won't! They are not for sale." The man said while placing the owl on the counter.

"What do you mean? This is a store that sells animals, right?"

"Not these, they are dangerous creatures, and the only way you can buy them is if you have a document from the ministry for allowance."

Harry's stomach sunk, as he eyed the two snakes.

~What is happening, Harry?~ Ivy asked confused, her tongue tickling his cheek.

~They're saying I can't take you two.~ He answered in parseltongue and the owner took a step back to the hisses coming from the boy's mouth and to the deadly hisses coming from the snakes towards him.

Harry chuckled, unable to refrain from a laugh.

"What is going on, Harry?" Hagrid asked, confused by everything that was happening.

"Ash said he would love to see him try to take them away from me." The owner's face went white as his hands searched for his wand.

"Don't bother, don't you know dragon snakes are resistant to magic, you doofus?" Lucius said with a sharp voice, walking to the counter and taking a note where he started writing something.

"I'll write to the ministry about this, so you can give Mr. Potter his snakes."

Harry's eyebrows went up when he heard that, just like the owner.

"But sir, I can't sell them without the proper-"

"Are you're saying that I can't produce said document until the end of the day?" His question was like a slap, and the man just shook his head.

"No sir, I was merely-"

"Then it's settled, I'll pay for them for Mr. Potter, of course."

"Ah- You don't need to-" Harry started but Lucius looked at him with a curious expression, it was amused, tender, and proud at the same time.

"Do not mention, Mr. Potter. Dragon snakes are rather rare and because of that, they're sold at exorbitant prices, so consider this to be a gift, to a future Slytherin and ally."

Harry wondered how pricey were the snakes when he heard the man say one thousand galleons.

Each.

Before they left, Harry went next to Lucius Malfoy.

"Mr. Malfoy, thank you for the help in getting them, but I intend to pay back the gold you spent, being in debt with someone is not something that I'm comfortable with." He said that with such authority, that even Lucius was unable to retort.

"Very well, Mr. Potter. I do hope to hear from you soon." And with that, both Malfoys left with a last look at the boy.

"Why didn't you tell me you could talk to snakes, Harry?"

"Well, I didn't know how you'd react, so I was a little scared."

"You don't have to worry about that from me, Harry, you can tell me whatever you want."

Harry felt a warm feeling in his chest, wondering why this wild-looking giant man had such a trustful aura.

Harry saw Ash almost falling off the table trying to look around and grabbed him, bringing him back to the center of the table.

"Oh, they are really beautiful, aren't they?" Hagrid asked with a smile, his hand going for the blue snake.

"Careful, Ash doesn't like to be squished." Harry alerted.

"Oh, he wouldn't mind me, would he?" Hagrid extended his free hand since the other one was busy with Ivy around it.

~Don't hurt him, Ash, he's kind.~ Harry said in parseltongue.

~I know.~ Ash hissed softly, allowing himself to be picked by Hagrid, who started to carefully pet his scales.

"I like this one." Ivy said, disappearing inside Hagrid's vests.

"She said she liked you."

"Really?!" Hagrid asked with such joy, that Harry was unable to refrain from a smile.

After a few minutes, their food arrived, and Harry asked in parseltongue again.

~What do you like to eat the most?~

Ivy came out of Hagrid's coat with literally a mouse in her mouth, drips of blood staining Hagrid's clothes, but he didn't seem to care, making Harry frown.

~We eat anything really, but we do like rodents. Ash has a taste for squirrels.~

~Umm, what about human food, do you like it?~

~No, they are all mushy and soggy. Although we can talk to you and sound like an equal, we are still predators, so we need the blood, meat, and fat from our pray.~

~What if I started asking for food specifically for you?~

~What do you mean?~ Ash asked.

Harry stopped because there was a family standing right next to him, watching him speak in parseltongue, their eyes locked on the snakes.

"Hello, can I help you?" Harry asked in an educated tone, and the family practically ran out of the room.

"Wha-"

"I told you that people would get scared of your parseltongue." Hagrid said with a smile and leaned on.

"But I'm curious, how can you switch between English and... The hissing?"

Harry gave a little thought, imagining what he meant by hissing.

"Well, when I look at them, I can feel a funny sensation, it is like the air around us change, I don't really know how to explain, but when that happens, I think I'm talking in parseltongue."

"You can't hear yourself hissing?"

"No, to me I'm speaking normally- Wait, do I hiss?"

"Yes, just like a snake."

Harry looked at the two snakes and instead of finding that information disturbing, he found himself liking that very much.

Harry returned to his conversation, trying to hear his own hissing, but to him, it was simply English.

~I was wondering, our ancestors also had the habit of eating raw meat after hunting, and that drastically increased their chances of getting diseases, so when they started to cook their food, their life span increased tremendously.~

~So you're suggesting-~

~Yea, I'll study about your physiology so I can create a few recipes that will give you nutrients and are tasty at the same time, I'm used to cooking, so it shouldn't be that hard.~

~Thank you, Mr. Potter.~ Ash said and Harry extended his hand towards him.

~I said companion, Ash, not pet. You don't have to call me mister or sir, I'm not your owner, I'm your friend.~ He saw the blue snake moving to wrap himself around his arm with a strange hiss, that he could almost understand as a smile.

the end

fields.title: Hello Darkness
fields.summary: Master Obi-Wan Kenobi tries speaking up for Ahsoka during a Council meeting, when he is ignored he begins questioning everything he knows, the Force shows him the end of the war and then gives him a choice. Back at the beginning, can Obi-Wan learn to listen to the Force over the authority of the Order? Will Qui-Gon listen to the Force over his own fears? Time Travel! Pre-prequels!
